abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Avian
            Influenza Control and Human Pandemic Preparedness and
            Response Project is to minimize the threat in the Kyrgyz
            Republic posed by the Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza
            (HPAI) infection as well as other poultry and livestock
            diseases and to prepare for the control and response to an
            influenza pandemic and other zoonotic or infectious disease
            emergencies in humans. The project objectives, revised
            earlier in 2010 to expand project scope, continue to be
            attainable, with noteworthy results and positive outcomes
            already achieved. The project implementation is progressing
            well, reflected in a consistently satisfactory rating for
            implementation progress over the project life. $3.19 million
            or 73 percent of total International Development Association
            (IDA) grant funds have disbursed. Financial management
            performance is satisfactory with good internal controls and
            there are no overdue audits. Financial covenants have been
            complied with. The extensional is necessary to allow
            additional time for remaining project activities to be
            completed. Implementation was delayed by a protracted
            process to complete the earlier project restructuring
            compounded by some disruption of project activities due to
            civil unrest in 2010. The Government has revised the project
            action plan to reflect an updated implementation schedule to
            complete project activities by December 31, 2011. The
            project team fully supports the request as the extension
            will provide the time needed to fully achieve project objectives.
